revised_title: Nuclear Orientation at Very Low Temperatures: Establishing a Method of Alinement and its Application to Cobalt-60
tldr: The authors developed a method of nuclear alinement called magnetic hyperfine structure polarization and applied it to cobalt-60. They cooled single crystals to very low temperatures using adiabatic demagnetization and measured the anisotropic distribution of gamma rays emitted from the oriented nuclei. The largest anisotropy observed was 33%, and the results were fitted to theoretical curves to deduce the magnetic moment of cobalt-60.
